instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that will not boot, just Apple logo and loading bar hangs.  Ran ASD because customer says never water damaged or dropped.  Chipset(test 1) Management Engine Test is failing?? Can anyone tell me what this means??  It is saying verifies presence of Management Engine is failing????

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: Seems ME region problem..... Try programming bios with clean ME region....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: They bought a BIOS chip off ebay to replace the original one that had an EFI password. Get them to give you the original BIOS chip

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: I don't think so, the computer has all of the original parts. After opening there is a little liquid damage near the right fan/speaker but I see no corrosion.  The hard drive boots no problem from another unit.  Is there any sensor that would cause this??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: The customer is original owner of computer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: Also, the computer chimes and boots and then slowly the loading bar fills up but it does not load.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: I don't think so, the computer has all of the original parts. After opening there is a little liquid damage near the right fan/speaker but I see no corrosion. The hard drive boots no problem from another unit. Is there any sensor that would cause this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: The customer is original owner of computer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: I have none of these boards available. I would wait and see if duke has an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a clean ME for you to flash. Do you have a BIOS programmer? This is often a BIOS issue on retinas, and here ASD is even telling you it is a BIOS issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: Please upload your original dump here for analysis. But first check the circuit around <TRANSISTOR>Q1920</TRANSISTOR> and see if the resistors are not corroded. You can pull down <SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT_R</SIGNAL> permanently to test, but audio will then not work of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: Could you please tell me how to get orignal dump?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> failing ASD
threads.message: I do not have a BIOS programmer, I remember you doing it with one of my boards in class. Can you tell me where to buy and how to use??
